column5: articlename=J.R.R Tolkien, Rare hand-written letter by Tolkien (eBay item number: 231077543050)

thumb]]: Dutch translation]] of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', and replies to a question about the etymology of the name ''[[Númenor]]'', among other things.

[[File:Ossendrijver 5 January 1961 (1).j: *'''Publication:''' A large excerpt from the letter was published as [[Letter 227]] in ''[[The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien]]''.
Númenor, shortened form of ''Númenórë'', is my own invention, compounded from ''nūme-n'' going down" (√ndū, nū), sunset, West, and ''nōre'' "land, country" = ''Westernesse''"<ref>{{webcite
column4: articlename=Holograph MS of Letter 227, correcting published etymology of "Númenor" (#1144)
